intro: Cyanea macrostegia, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the tropical climate with its thick, waxy leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by water. Cyanea macrostegia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
